comment: just overall feels more slick

:ctwokinds-maevecute_xmas:
the one stupid habit I have that is that I often right-click to hit 'refresh' on desktop/folders to reorganize things occasionally and that is now hidden under the 2nd level :\
I'm hoping they change that or I get used to it whichever comes first
I think back to some of the changes in Windows over the years though like from the Classic W98 Start Menu to XP and how horrible that was at first with the long jumplists going away
I don't think the W11 changes feel as severe at least
photos feels snappier \o/
oh yeah it is much more useful feeling too
W10's felt dumbed down compared to previous ones at first, never really grew on me
so many more buttons now
:point_right::red_circle:
:ctwokinds-zenshocked_xmas::point_left:
The maximize button now has like instant window layout snapping capabilities, I haven't really adapted to that seems useful in certain situations.
:cw0lfmare-EmberO: okay now I want this on my work pc
I use the snap function a ton
yeah honestly for productivity it feels like a step back to the W7 practicality days
yeah the whole snapping thing got completely beefed up
there is actually an enhancement to that functionality in the PowerToys utility by Msft called FancyZones...
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/powertoys/fancyzones
it sort of replicates like the Dell Display manager app functionality I think, but as a Windows utility
there are other bonus tools in PowerToys that are like easter egg-y type features that just didn't get baked into the OS for some reason or other.
I think that would work on W10 too possibly, not sure though
ah it has a color picker app too looks like that allows more freestyle color samples from random windows and places apparently.
just weird oddball features like that
